questions.question: What is the full form of RAM?
What is the difference between RAM and ROM?
options: RAM is volatile, ROM is non-volatile
RAM is non-volatile, ROM is volatile
RAM is permanent, ROM is temporary
RAM is temporary, ROM is permanent
questions.correct_answer: RAM is volatile, ROM is non-volatile

questions.question: What is the difference between a compiler and an interpreter?
options: A compiler converts code into machine code, an interpreter executes code line by line
A compiler executes code line by line, an interpreter converts code into machine code
A compiler is a hardware device, an interpreter is a software program
A compiler is a software program, an interpreter is a hardware device
questions.correct_answer: A compiler converts code into machine code, an interpreter executes code line by line

questions.question: What is the difference between a procedural programming language and an object-oriented programming language?
options: Procedural languages focus on data, object-oriented languages focus on functions
Procedural languages focus on functions, object-oriented languages focus on data
Procedural languages are older, object-oriented languages are newer
Procedural languages are newer, object-oriented languages are older
questions.correct_answer: Procedural languages focus on functions, object-oriented languages focus on data

questions.question:
Read the following conversation:

Person A) What is the weather today?
Person B) It is sunny and 75 degrees.

What was the weather like?
Options:
[A]. sunny and 75
[B]. 75 degrees
[C]. cloudy and 75
[D]. 75 and sunny

Write a short summary for this paragraph:

“The most important thing in communication is to hear what isn't said.” – Mark Twain
options: A. This is a quote by Mark Twain about communication.
B. The most important thing in communication is to hear what is said.
C. This is a quote by Mark Twain about listening.
D. None of the above options.

questions.question:
Listen to the following audio clip and answer the following question:

Audio clip:

Hello, my name is John. I am calling to inquire about the new car that you have advertised online.

What is the name of the person who called?
Options:
[A]. John
[B]. None of the above options.
[C]. Jane
[D]. Mary

Write a short speech about the importance of communication.

Your speech should be no more than 2 minutes long.
options: A. This is a speech about the importance of communication.
B. This is a speech about the importance of listening.
C. This is a speech about the importance of reading.
D. None of the above options.

questions.question:
Read the following paragraph:

“The most important thing in communication is to hear what isn't said.” – Mark Twain

What is the main idea of this paragraph?
Options:
[A]. Communication is important.
[B]. Listening is important.
[C]. Mark Twain is important.
[D]. None of the above options.

questions.question: You are invited to a networking event. What do you do?
Your boss asks you to complete a task that you don't know how to do. What do you do?
options: Ask for help from your boss
Try to figure it out yourself
questions.correct_answer: Ask for help from your boss

questions.question: You are given a project with a very tight deadline. How do you manage your time?
You are asked to give a presentation to a group of people. How do you prepare?
options: Make eye contact with the audience

questions.question: You are in a job interview and the interviewer asks you about a time when you faced a challenge. What do you say?
options: Tell them about a time when you failed
Tell them about a time when you overcame a challenge
Tell them about a time when you were successful
Tell them about a time when you were praised
questions.correct_answer: Tell them about a time when you overcame a challenge

questions.question: You are working on a project and you have a lot of different tasks to complete. How do you stay organized?
questions.category: Handling multitasking and managing multiple assignments

questions.question: You are given a project that is due in a few weeks. How do you start working on it?
options: Break the project down into smaller tasks
questions.correct_answer: Break the project down into smaller tasks
